revision.text:
{{good article}} [[File:Adventdalen IMG 9867 Adventdalen Skolten.jpg|thumb|[[Adventdalen]] in Svalbard]] '''ISO 3166-2:SJ''' is the entry for [[Svalbard and Jan Mayen]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] standard published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO). The standard defines codes for names of principal [[country subdivision|subdivisions]] of all countries coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Svalbard and Jan Mayen does not exist as an administrative region, but rather consists of two separate parts of [[Norway]] under separate jurisdictions—[[Svalbard]] and [[Jan Mayen]]. Further subdivision for Svalbard and Jan Mayen occurs under Norway's entry, [[ISO 3166-2:NO]], namely {{mono|NO-21}} for Svalbard and {{mono|NO-22}} for Jan Mayen. There are currently no ISO 3166-2 codes for Svalbard and Jan Mayen.<ref>[https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:SJ ISO Online Browsing Platform: SJ]</ref>
==Allocation== Svalbard and Jan Mayen constitute two outlying areas of Norway. Svalbard is an archipelago in the [[Arctic]] about midway between mainland Norway and the [[North Pole]]. The group of islands ranges from [[74th parallel north|74°]] to [[81st parallel north|81° north]] latitude, and from [[10th meridian east|10°]] to [[35th meridian east|35° east]] longitude.<ref name=npi>{{cite news |title=Svalbard |publisher=[[Norwegian Polar Institute]] |url=http://www.npolar.no/en/the-arctic/svalbard/index.html |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uCuu7Sa |deadurl=no}}</ref> The [[Svalbard Treaty]] of 1920 recognizes Norwegian sovereignty,<ref name=treaty>{{cite news |title=Svalbard Treaty |publisher=[[Governor of Svalbard]] |url=http://www.sysselmannen.no/hovedEnkel.aspx?m=45301 |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uD75yZV |deadurl=no}}</ref> and the 1925 ''[[Svalbard Act]]'' established administration by the appointed [[Governor of Svalbard]].<ref>{{cite book |url=http://www.regjeringen.no/en/dep/jd/Documents-and-publications/Reports-to-the-Storting-White-Papers/Reports-to-the-Storting/19992000/report-no-9-to-the-storting-/5-The-administration-of-Svalbard.html?id=456897 |title=Report No. 9 to the Storting (1999-2000): Svalbard |publisher=[[Norwegian Ministry of Justice and the Police]] |chapter=5 The administration of Svalbard |date=29 October 1999 |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uDB3oM1 |deadurl=no}}</ref> Jan Mayen is a [[volcanic island]] in the [[Arctic Ocean]] located at the border of the [[Norwegian Sea]] and the [[Greenland Sea]]. Since 1994, the island has been administrated by the [[County governor (Norway)|County Governor of Nordland]], with some authority delegated to the station commander.<ref name=wfbjm>{{cite web |url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/jn.html |title=Jan Mayen |publisher=[[Central Intelligence Agency]] |work=[[World Fact Book]] |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uDGPlGS |deadurl=no}}</ref>
Allocation of codes for Svalbard and Jan Mayen occurs under Norway's entry in ISO 3166-2, [[ISO 3166-2:NO]]. By virtue of the collective [[ISO 3166-1]] code {{mono|SJ}}, Svalbard and Jan Mayen were grouped together and allocated the Internet [[country code top-level domain]] (ccTLD) [[.sj]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iana.org/domains/root/db/sj.html |title=Delegation Record for .SJ |publisher=[[Internet Assigned Numbers Authority]] |date=13 November 2009 |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uDRWbkj |deadurl=no}}</ref> As with Bouvet Island's TLD [[.bv]], policy prohibits any registration with the .sj domain, forcing institutions connected to Svalbard to use Norway's domain [[.no]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.norid.no/omnorid/bv-sj.en.html |title=The .bv and .sj top level domains |publisher=[[Norid]] |date=3 August 2010 |accessdate=4 March 2012 |archivedate=4 March 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65uDTqOSy |deadurl=no}}</ref>
==List of codes== There are currently no subdivisions assigned codes in ISO 3166-2:SJ. Svalbard and Jan Mayen are however given separate codes in Norway's ISO 3166-2 entry, [[ISO 3166-2:NO]].
